JobTitle: Senior Manager, Sales Strategy and Operations
JobFullDesc:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

Envision waking up each morning energized by the opportunity to lead strategic business change in an exciting Sales Operations environment! The right individual will be working on transformational programs and projects that enable operational scale.
As the Senior Manager Sales Strategy & Operations, you will partner with smart people in a company with a culture that differentiates. An individual with a proven track record to execute both strategically and tactically. One who is driven by data and facts and live by performance management, metrics, and reporting. This opportunity will be a dedicated business partner, strategist, and thought leader for key stakeholders within our matrixed organization. The role reports to the Sr. Director of Business Operations.
Focus Areas:
Leading change in Sales Operations processes and systems, specifically:
Fiscal Year PlanningTerritory ManagementSales quotasSales Compensation

What You Will Be Doing:

Lead the transformation of the planning process globally (includes headcount, territory definitions & assignments, target setting by segment/territory, attainment, etc.)Implement the governance and operational working practices of project and program teams.Lead program teams to execute defined projects with clear scope, timelines, and risk management.Collaborate cross-functionally to collect current and future state processes with a focus on efficiency, effectiveness, and scale.Provide transparency to leadership with open communication to ensure visibility of progress and challenges.Be a trusted advisor to teams by motivating change and provide ongoing consultative advice.Dependency identification and risk management with planned remediations.Definition of program team operating models, mission, scope, workstreams, timelines, and meeting cadenceProcess development, process re-engineering, and process management

What You Bring Along:

Critical thinking that links go-to-market strategy to operations.Delivery of multiple, global projects simultaneously Ability to build credibility, trust, and rapport with team members at all levels, within the matrixed organization.A forward thinker who takes initiative, identifies gaps, and makes recommendations.Capture business requirements and work with IT and functional teams to build and deploy business capabilities.Energy and passion for inspiring change and motivating teams to achieve.
Qualifications Required:
10+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, Management Consulting or Business OperationsExperience leading global initiatives with multiple workstreamsERP (NetSuite), CRM (Salesforce), Exactly (Comp) systems experience (or similar systems)A track record of successful delivery with desired business resultsUndergraduate degree or equivalent experiencePMP certification is a plusLean SIx Sigma certification is a plus
